alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 2:27PM MDT until June 07 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Fergus County in central Montana... * Until 500 PM MDT. * At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lewistown and Heath. This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Spring Creek, Casino Creek, Middle Fork Big Spring Creek, Little Casino Creek, Boyd Creek, South Fork McDonald Creek, Hansen Creek, East Fork Big Spring Creek, Cottonwood Creek and Marcott Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
